ProjectDescr.Title: Development of disease-specific smart biodelivery system based on pharmabiotic microbes
ProjectDescr.Description: Established a genetic toolbox of more than four gut microbiome-derived disease therapeutic candidate expression systems and disease-specific self-killing switches for resident beneficial gut microbes. In addition, we developed an encapsulation technology and colonization evaluation technology to enhance the intestinal delivery and selective colonization of ultra-highly anaerobic gut microbes, and validated the colonization and therapeutic efficacy of the developed bioconstructs in animal models of colon cancer, liver cancer, and inflammatory enterocolitis.

Grant.Title: Development of disease-specific smart biodelivery system based on pharmabiotic microbes
